description:
This place is very conveniently located in a busy area. I usually top by this branch to grab a coffee on my way to work. It is full of people and long line at even early hours. 

Overall, this place is fine and I do understand that they get busy from time to time. However, my last experience with location was not pleasant. 

I ordered a hot chocolate with no whip cream and waited about 15 minutes to get my order ready. Once it was ready I picked it up and realized that there is a whip cream in it on my way to out. Immediately returned and told it to server over the counter. I was thinking that they will replace is promptly so that I could get on my way. However, the lady picked up my cup and without saying a "sorry" just dumped top part of hot chocolate and fill it with milk. Ok I get it, you might have a bad day, or tired, but at least don't do it in front of customer. It just feels like blank point insult to your daily customers. 

Anyways, I will stop by at another Starbucks down the the street from now on. Even though it doesn't change anything in eyes of corporate company, I would at least get better customer experience with some respect.
author: Jason M.

description:
5:45pm Monday evening, not busy

Me: Can I get an iced decaf latte?
Barista: yes, 1 matcha green tea latte
Me: actually I wanted an iced decaf latte
Barista: (changes to a decaf latte)
Me: can you make that iced?
Barista: (changes it to iced decaf latte)

Third time's the charm
author: Emily L.

description:
From a service standpoint and your typical offerings that you expect at Starbucks, this place is standard. 

However, there isn't a lot of seating and no outdoor seating. For folks that just want to come in, grab your drink, and head out, then that shouldn't matter. 

For those of us that like working at a coffee shop when we travel or are out of the office, I prefer places with ample seating. 

It's not really this places fault. It's just a smaller Starbucks in the city.
author: Matt M.

description: Who hasn't been to this Starbuck's on their way to North Beach from Union Square. The bus stop is right at the Tunnel. I stop by this Starbuck's near Union Square and the Tunnel. I don't have a problem with it. It feels nicer than some others in the city and it's always bustling with people. Pick something up to go and leave.
author: Denise C.

description: Good grief, this place is terrible. It's like Starbucks corporate has left that store alone to be run with no standards. As someone who goes to 3-5 starbucks a week in nor-cal, this one is the twilight zone. The music is blasting at club level volume, the floor was sticky in a 4 foot area by the sugar , appearing to be there for hours. To top it all off there were multiple people standing there with me waiting to ask for something & the 3 employees were singing to the music instead of coming to help. Unbelievable.
author: S V.

description: This Starbucks could use some help. I get the allure of the location (darn, is it central!) but be prepared for a busy, cramped, and dirty space. Due to the aforementioned location, the wait times here are very long. The experience left a lot to be desired.
author: Nic Z.

description: Terrible Starbucks. It's next to Union Square, so it's very packed with tourists tryna get their caffeine fix. We waited 15 minutes for an iced coffee, which should take about 30 seconds because it's all pre-made.  There were a couple of unhappy, uncaffeinated folks in front of us, but I wasn't that upset because at least the coffee was consistent, and the bathroom was open.
author: Thu P.

description:
Came here very late on a weekend eve and the baristas were friendly and cheerful, even though it was a strange night. The guy behind the counter went out of his way to find cake pops for us (thank you!) and was super nice about it. 

I got the feeling this place gets a lot of tourists and/or folks who work in downtown. It was also kind of messy, but I think it's because of the volume of people coming in and out. Still, a good choice if you're staying at one of the nearby hotels.
author: Lis B.

description: This is an okay Starbucks. It's not ideal for working/studying for long hours because of the lack outlets. The location is convenient and is walking distance from Bart. I thought the baristas were subpar for Starbucks' standards and more occupied with chatting with each other. The nice part is this place is open until pretty late even though they randomly closed early this week.
author: Tabitha H.

description: Absolutely worst Starbucks ever- I put in a mobile order - arrived 10 minutes later, waited for 20 minutes for them to start my order.  It was literally 50 minutes for me to get my food!
author: Erin B.

description: We ordered a hot salted caramel mocha and a caramel apple spice. The line was fairly short on a cold, Monday evening and we got our drinks right away! I was amazed at how fast the drinks were made, after we paid and walked over to the other counter, the drinks were ready already! A perfect location during the holiday season before or after you visit the festivities at Union Square :)
author: Bailey L.

description: I was ordering the new Triple Mocha frappuccino and the barista told me that they "ran out"?? How in the hell can they run out when they advertise this new drink to get people to try it..That is false advertisement!!! They didn't even make a sign to tell people that they ran out and we waited in a long line for it. Very disappointed..
author: Russell Y.

description: I just have to say that the employees Thanh and Candy were super helpful this evening! I was very exhausted from a long day and still had more work to do, even though it was after 8PM on a Friday night. Whenever I'm tired, it's difficult to comprehend even a small amount of information being thrown my way. I had so many questions about my options for a Frappuccino to help give me a little extra "kick" to get the rest of my work completed. Thanh and Candy explained all the possible options in such a patient and friendly manner. I actually felt bad throwing so many questions at them at once. But they didn't mind at all and made me feel super welcome in this establishment. If I were to ever hire a customer service team for my business, they would be the first two I would hire. Thank you so much to both of you!
author: Peter C.

description: They show no sense of urgency when preparing drink. Employees seem miserable. I've waited 20 min for a drink and the place wasn't even that busy. Maybe they are understaffed? Poor management? Idk. They need help at this store for sure
author: Taya S.

description: It's pretty slow. Standard-quality Starbucks but being across and near to multiple hotels it's a busy one! They should have their efficiency down better. My latte was slower than normal, but I had to ask and then wait some more for my breakfast wrap. It still took some time. If you have some time (most people in a Starbucks before 7am don't) this place is fine; otherwise know what you're getting into.
author: Emily M.

description:
This is the slowest Starbucks ever. Unfriendly staff. Person behind me asked the barista how she was doing and she just looked away. Seriously. Took about 10 min to get my espresso when there were just two people ahead of me. 
I'd walk 3 blocks to the nearest Starbucks and skip this one.
author: Andrew J.

description: This place is sucks, a simple order like plane bagel with cream cheese  will take 20minutes even only 2 person in line  plus they're not gonna give you the right order.
author: Liezel V.

description: Slowest starbucks ever.  Waited for a simple order of a breakfast danish for 20 minutes to tell me that they didn't have that item.  Last time I'll be coming to this location.
author: Jeff C.

description: 20 + minute wait for an online mobile order.  Very slow service.  There were no napkins or creamer available.  Dirty.  Order was not done right.
author: Pramod R.

description: If this is your Starbucks and you bart to the city, put your order in at West oakland station because you will still be waiting for 10 minutes for it once you get to the store. Slow staff at an unreal level
author: Alyssa I.

description: This is my go-to Starbucks when I stay in Union Square.  My coffee tastes better here for some reason.  The baristas are always slammed, but have always been friendly.
author: Veronica A.

description: Great Starbucks location. It's a bit small and crowded but will do the job for a quick coffee break.
author: Chris L.

description: This is the worst Starbucks I've ever been to. They wouldn't let six months pregnant woman use the restroom. If they responded with respect and good attitude when stating the 'customer only' policy it would be more acceptable, instead the barista (not the cashier) was extremely arrogant and mean. As a 10+ year Starbucks reward card holder, I m very disappointed.
author: Haotian Z.

description:
Conviently located across the street from The Grand Hyatt, it's often busy with lines out the door, but the staff was good at keeping things moving every time I visited.

On one occasion I had a skinny latte and on another a mango iced tea lemonade.

I was unimpressed by the former, but the latter was super refreshing.
author: Lucky S.

description: I've never seen a group of people less interested in making drinks. 4 people standing behind the bar, one girl dancing and putting stickers on cups slowly, and making a drink every now and then. Lobby is filled to the brim w/ people waiting for drinks. 1 star for cleanliness, 1 for friendly cashier.  I'm a former partner, and this is absolutely ridiculous.
author: Danielle-ah N.

description:
All I would like to let this establishment know is that cleanliness is key. Specially in such a populated and congested area like Union Square.  The floors had dry coffee stains that seem to be from a day or two ago.  There were empty boxes by the restrooms that simply seemed to be trash! The windows and entrance had smudges and finger prints.... If this is what is visible to consumers,  I wouldn't want to know what goes on behind the counter. Maybe Health Department should pay them a visit.  
On a separate note, the service and drinks were good. But please CLEAN THIS PLACE UP!
author: JC M.

description:
This is one of the worst locations I've ever been to. They're employees were so unprofessional. One employee in particular who was male with black somewhat curly hair with terrible washed out green highlights had the worst attitude of them all. My mother and I waited patiently on line to order and we waited a total of 15 minutes online. When we ordered my mother ordered a non fat cappuccino dry, and she said extra extra dry. When we received our drinks, her drink was filled to a brim and nothing of what she had asked, she kindly asked them to remake it and the guy with the terrible hair threw attitude and was scoffing. We waited 20 minutes for the drink which he hadn't made and yet again we went up to confront him. He looked at us and my mother said "I've been waiting patiently for twenty minutes for a drink I ordered 30 minutes ago and had messed up once. Is my drink done yet?" With the worst attitude I have ever witnessed, he barked at us telling us it wasn't his problem and that that he didn't care that we were waiting for that long. We called the manger over and while we were speaking to him the terrible haired employee started mocking us, throwing his hands on the air, flipping us off, making funny faces, and was being extremely unprofessional at his job. I'm not sure how a man like him even acquired a job. The manager was laughing and didn't even care a bit which was even more disgusting. I have never been more appalled in my life. And I am a avid customer to Starbucks. I am very disappointed that this Starbucks was very unprofessional and disgusting towards us. The girl who kindly remade our drink in the end was super professional and sweet. I wish I would have gotten all of their names but the male employee who was rude ended up taking his off so I couldn't put his name in a review and the manager didn't have his on in the first place. 
There are many
More Starbucks in the area that I suggest you go to. This place deserves zero stars and you shouldn't wast your time on this place nor your money.
author: Charlize C.

description: The SLOWEST Starbucks in San Francisco!!!! Maybe even the WORLD...it always takes 20-30 minutes for my morning bagel and not to mention every time I order a frappe it's always made wrong. But the management is always kind.
author: Crystal M.

description: Sloooowessst Starbucks in the entire SF, maybe in the entire Starbucks company. Trust me when I say that this Starbucks is well-staffed, but operationally poor in making decisions. A bunch of their staff are always at the back goofing around when the coffee bar is struggling. This is the closest one from where I work, but I always try to avoid this location. I used their mobile app which is awesome, but once you get to the store after 5-8 minutes you are forced to wait another 10-15 minutes on top of that until your drink is ready. Sometimes I just want to jump into their bar and make my own drink. I felt like I was a thousand years old when I walked out of this location for a latte. No Star!!!
author: Ryan H.

description: This is by far the worst Starbucks I've been. I got my order wrong.  A iced caramel macchiato with 4 shot of espresso and got only milk in my drink, ask them if they could make another, i wait 5 minutes and I got the same order only milk with ice, waste of time.
author: Blanca V.

description: There were 3 people behind the counter. I waited 20 minutes to get my drink. And there was only 2 people in front of me. Took him 20 minutes to make 3 drinks? He was standing there drinking, wondering, and chatting.
author: Kailin Z.

description: Worst Starbucks ever!! Ordered an large ice black tea with light ice. I watched the lady blending my order with 1/4 cup of black tea and 3/4 cup of water. Plus I ended up getting half cup of ice with 10 minute wait. It tasted like water!! This is ridiculous!! Come on!! Why do I have to pay $3 for a cup of water?!?! Why can't Yelp allows people to give zero star? Never coming back again!!!!!!!
author: Huang C.

description: This is probably the slowest Starbucks in the neighborhood. But I always forget that. The one by the Chinatown Dragon Gate has consistently better service. 2 Stars.
author: Alex D.

description: Haven't been here for seven months a whole new crew.  Service just as good as before.  Miss seeing my old friends.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Their service are always ehh especially when it comes to the holiday seasons everyone just wants their drinks. It's always hectic for the workers so I understand if they're moody or what not. Came in to try their chestnut praline latte which is a holiday drink and if I don't get it now then I'll have to wait till next year. I wanted to try the iced version because I would usually get it warm so I got the iced version. I love when the barista/cashier asks if you want whip cream cuz I forget to say no whip cream at times here and there. They took a while to make my drink cuz the place was packed with thirsty folks. I was expecting a little too much for the drink because it tastes just like regular iced coffee with that strong coffee taste and a slight hint of chestnut in there. Overall it was pretty good just that they put way too much ice.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I've been here for a snack before going drinking. I've been here for a coffee before going drinking. I've been here to wait until meeting up with friends to go drinking. I've even been here for wi-fi access, no drinking though. Sure, I can do the same things at other Starbucks (or cafes) but this location is near both Union Square and Chinatown so it works out better.

The place is busy but efficient which is great. It has constant customer-turnover consisting of mostly tourists, students, homeless and locals. Perhaps in that order. Therefore, some seats and tables are clean and some are not. Be careful where you sit down.
author: Peter L.

description: Horrible service . Ordered my two drinks they ask me my name so I give it to them. Then they say my name with two drinks in my hand and give one of my drink to another person . So I ask for my other drink and they said oh someone else took it and I looked at the girl and said no you gave it to someone . And then she looks back and says well they had the same drink. It was super unprofessional and disrespectful that she talked back and gave me attitude . Wasn't needed and wasn't appreciated . There's no point of getting names if they aren't being utilized
author: Isabel P.

description: Not a big fan of Starbucks but thank god this place was here. After 16 cups of horrible coffee throughout SF at small coffee shops I wanted to support and enjoy I had to run to Starbucks to get a strong cup of joe.
author: Dean P.

description: There were only two employees that I could see working tonight. One was courteous, and seemed interested in my request to be fulfilled. He alone is the reason that I am awarding two stars. He was also the employee who prepared mine, and my groups beverage which were all made well. That being said, the other stocky employee made me feel like I was being a nuisance by politely asking for some toilet paper, or some napkins to use the bathroom. I have worked in food industry positions before, and I understand how difficult it may be to accommodate anything out of your primary role (in this case making drinks etc). However, when I asked there were only two officers in line that were being serviced by the other employee. In other words there was no reason to shirk off my small request to restock something as basic as toilet paper. The stocky employee that I asked for the toilet paper from went to the back about 5 mins after I asked and I was under the impression he was getting the toilet paper, but in fact he wasn't. It wasn't until the friendly employee asked him two separate times did he finally get toilet paper. Before the friendly employee informed me that the toilet paper was restocked. By the time he did so my group had finished all of their drinks and were solely waiting on me. I am thankful I don't have any medical issues that require prompt bathroom access in public spaces.  but not before he used the bathroom himself. I have also submitted photos representing the chaotic state of the bathroom itself which leads me to believe that they are negligent in general with the maintenance of the bathroom. That is a health code issue, and it didn't boost my confidence in their sanitation behind the counter either. Anyways, some may say this is a small infraction but in my opinion customers shouldn't be made to feel invisible, unimportant, or like a nuisance. Also sanitation both in and around food prep is essential for a safe and quality product. I won't be returning to this shop, despite the one friendly employee, I don't feel comfortable that they are clean enough for my standards.
author: Claudia V.

description: I have worked very close to this Starbucks for over a year and I can say that without a doubt it is the worst Starbucks I've ever been to. The baristas don't pay attention to detail and do not work with a sense of urgency. Because of this, I only mobile order and make sure to leave a ten minute window to account for their slow service. Today I ordered an iced coffee and breakfast sandwich. I came in ten minutes later and they hadn't even started my order. I had to tell them that I did a mobile order, which they seemed oblivious to. Once they started my order 12 minutes later, they were sold out of the sandwich I ordered. I will never go here again. Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.
author: Mary S.

description: I waited 10 minutes just for a ice water, and their attitude is not good, just tell me if the store don't give ice water, no need to treat people like that.
author: Shuying P.

description:
Wow I've been insulted by the manager of this Starbucks.  Her name was Jasmin, a black lady with curly hair.  This incident happened after celebrating my 40th birthday, December 2nd at 8:45 pm.  Jasmin I will contact your district supervisors and address the incident.  You as the store manager should set a good example for your employees.  Clearly you don't know how to manage a store and you shouldn't have been given the privilege to be a manager.  
So my husband went in to order a tall hot chocolate for my boy.  As she was writing the order on tall cup, I said that we would like to change it to grande.    My husband asked her if it is too late so she shook her head no.  However I interpreted as if she was shaking her head in annoyance.  I interpreted that way because she had so much attitude as I came to the register.  When I confronted her about it she said she was answering his question and then rolled her eyes.  Wow!!!  Couldn't believe it!  To top it off she was the manager!  I've never experienced a Starbucks manager with this much attitude!  No apologies she just shut me off wouldn't let me get  in another word and ignored me.  Starbucks how can you promote someone like her to this position?
author: Shelly H.

description:
Great to have a Starbucks near your hotel and almost every corner of San Francisco. LOL

I stopped by Starbucks because I couldn't stand shivering in the San Francisco Brrr cold weather and decided to get a tall hot mocha. 

The wait wasn't too long and the staff were friendly and organized with handling the crowd. I needed a place to charge my phone and the barista said I can use the outlets on the walls or she can charge it in the backroom. I thought that was nice of her. =)

This Starbucks is like any other Starbucks I've been to and I hardly drink coffee but in this weather, it's a total must!
author: Paul B.

description:
This Starbucks is great because its right before the entrance to Chinatown, 

I love going to this particular location because it is never that crowded compared to the other Starbucks in downtown.  The wait is never that long, and the baristas are always friendly and quick. 
They also have outlets to charge your phone, which is sooo necessary because people are literally on their phones all the time in tech obsessed sf. 

This is my fave starbucks to go to in downtown pssstttt
author: Tiffany Y.

description: People who want coffee in downtown San Francisco, want it with a sense of urgency. Both registers are never open. The lines are ridiculously slow. I can walk down to a farther location with a longer line and still get my coffee faster
author: Lisa X.

description: Employees at this location are pretty rude. The manager was the one taking drink orders and seemed really put out and a smart ass.
author: Katy M.

description: Cashier brown skin lady, English accent, with very curly black hair was not paying attention to what I say, no patience when told her to wait I was looking at other stuff on the counter near her she doesn't want me to wait just hurry up give me the money, don't know what she was doing very frustrating ordering from her isn't worth going back to the store, bad customer service experience from that girl she want people to wait for her but she can't wait for others shame on her she just working there to get paid for money/benefits. She made me repeat everything I say several times just because she can't hear a dam thing I said reason she wasn't paying attention to me at all probably did it on purpose just to get on people nerves but she want others to pay attention to her no fair such a loser should be fired from her job. Waste bunch my time, money, energy for this lame ass negative person with terrible customer service experience and gave me bad experience for nothing not worth going back got ripped off big time she should be fired never work there ever.
author: Lorrie T.

description:
Not the usual Starbucks experience. No smiles. No politeness. No space. No toilet. (Always conveniently broken.) Amber said go to McDonald's. Very rude.

Coffee is OK

Let me add to this review: 20min after: I asked for some hot water for the baby's food. Amber, at the pickup side, said I should stand back in line and be helped by another lady, even though the baby was screaming (note we had already picked up our coffees by then). She was busy wiping the counter. We explained we couldn't wait until 10 more orders were in, while the baby was screaming. Her answer: "I don't care. I only have 2 more days to work here."

Worst Starbucks experience ever. Amber, you just lost this Starbucks a client.
author: Panos G.

description: The restroom is out of order whenever I come here which is at least every other day and it's a really dirty and filthy location. Seems like no one really cares about cleaning the store.
author: Mutlu T.

description: The wait is always sooooo long at this Starbucks.  This becomes unbearable on a 95 degree day in SF without the AC!   There are 12 parties ahead of us waiting for their order.  Turn on the AC and make it bearable to your customers!
author: Rose L.

description: My review is that the staff is very cooperative and collective. The customer service is off the charts. I also love that this place closes late. It's a cross from the Grand Hyatt. Also near my 8 bay shore bus stop. Also soon come to this location The Apple Store. It's gonna gain more customers when the New Apple Store opens on this block!!! Much love to the staff of Starbucks .
author: Gary P.

description: The location was good because it was right across from our hotel and right in front of a good, busy area but the service was not good. Some of the workers were rude, they didn't know how to upload points to my card and they were slower than I've experienced at Starbucks before. Nearly five people got their drinks before mine and I had to wait nearly ten to fifteen minutes for two venti vanilla lattes.
author: Margaret P.

description:
This Starbuck's is about 10 feet from the front door of the Sir Francis Drake, so I went in a few times during our stay. I was impressed by the ginormous selection of pastries, but disappointed that they did not carry almond milk.

Be warned: Lines are enormous during the morning caffeine rush. For every minute you spend in the line, you'll spend 10 waiting for the overworked barista desperately trying to meet demand.
author: Jonathan G.

description: As a person that works graveyard shift coffee is a must. Today I came here to order a venti americano with extra shot and extra room. When I got my drink there were hardly any room. I asked them to add an extra shot as my drink is now too water down. She replied with there's already 5 shot. I explained my ordered. She poured my drink away with attitude. N appears to have reused the same coffee bean as my new drink is have full with the shots and looks and tastes like water. Awful. Service. Don't come here unless u want to be treat disrespectfully. And be given attitude when ur drinks is made wrong.
author: Ken T.

description: When I just finished paying for my drink and I wait for the cashier lady to tell me everything is goo, and I look over only to see her checking her phone. It's 9:20 am, a busy time specialist in the square. This is bad judgement and customer service.
author: Cristina P.

description:
I like a coffee shop with a nice place to sit and people watch. This one had that and a cozy spot to your left as you walk in.

The long bar that lined up the glass window is awesome. A couple of chairs behind that and it's a great set up.

The barristas are efficient and friendly. On a hot day this place has their AC on blast. Very much appreciated! 

Clean and easy to get to from Union Square shopping.
author: Janet D.

description:
They've got La Boulange pastries here.  Yummy

Fairly good size location.  There are seats strung along by the streetfront window, plus a long communal table, and a couple of round tables in the corner by the entrance.

The barista area is one of the most spacious ones I"ve seen at a Starbucks. Stretches from one end to the other.  The entire length of the store.

Located across the street from the Grand Hyatt hotel at Union Square and the Sutter Stockton Street parking garage.
author: Shirley N.

description: No lie, the bathroom looks like a homeless person is living in it. Sticky, stinky, with old clothes on the floor. The cashier told me my drink would take a while - not apologetically, more accusatorially. No one ever bussed the trash left on the table where I was sitting. Overall, trashy.
author: Jamie W.

description: Starbucks has awful coffee and food. La Boulange was a great alternative until Starbucks bought them out. I hate you starbucks.
author: Ryan T.

description:
I have never been so APPALLED by Starbuck's LACK of customer service in my life. I came in on 5/10/14, about twenty minutes BEFORE their Frappaccino Happy Hour was about to start. 
I asked for a Venti Caramel Frappaccino with two extra shots blended in, and I asked for it to be split into two Grande cups. I know that the shots included create extra volume in the drink when blended (I would know, I work in a licensed store), and since I'm paying $1.50 for the extra shots for a total of $6.45 for the drink, I wanted my leftovers that wouldn't fit in the normal Venti cup. The cashier proceeded to tell me that they can't split my drink in two cups. 

EXCUSE ME? I had to explain I wanted my leftovers, and again she told me, they can't split my drink because it's against store policy. She said she would let the person on bar know. For some reason this simple request became such a big problem because at the time I walked in and ordered, there was maybe one or two customers after me. She needed to talk to TWO of her coworkers, which caused a build up behind me. One of her coworker said she would split it for me.

I paid and walked to the bar. I proceeded to watch four WATER cups come out. 
So let me get this straight, it's fine for FREE water cups to come out, but I can't ask for an extra cup for a drink I PURCHASED? It's free advertisement that I'm walking around Union Square with a Starbuck's beverage and not just a free water..

To add insult to injury, I'm sure they messed up my drink. I asked the man who handed off the drink if my two shots were blended in, and the woman said they were. Funny, since I watched them make my drink and didn't see any shots go in. I asked for two ADDITIONAL shots to be added, not to REPLACE the frap roast.

Terrible customer service. With some many locations nearby I won't be returning to this one.
author: Jenna H.

description: I don't get the negative reviews like seriously. Its a Starbucks in the MOST popular area of San Francisco, of course its going to be fucking busy. This is my favorite Starbucks I always come to because its so close to my job. They're always super polite with me and quick to get my order to me! And my drink always taste good unlike the Starbucks that's another block down!! As long as i work at the same place this will be my go-to Starbucks.
author: Xochitl T.

description: Came in to have a quick cup of coffee. I had to use the washroom before and thank god I did before I ordered a drink. Completely disgusting, I would highly recommend the board of health to come and take a look. Used sanitary supplies and wet toilet paper sticky on the floor, urine all over the floor, NO toilet paper. It looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in 3 years. The smell was disgusting and I even asked two different baristas for toilet paper and one was too busy texting, and the other girl was too busy talking to a friend in line than to help a customer. I will be warning everyone not to come into this disgusting mess of a Starbucks, if the bathroom and service is this bad, imagine the coffee and the way it's handled. Excuse me while I go barf.
author: Juliana O.

description:
It sucks to have to give such a low review to one of my fav locations but the Barista was so rude. It ruined the complete experience. 

To single her out it was a chunky not so fun loving fatty named Ada who was successfully rude to not only myself but the customers in front of us. After messing up our order you would think shed want to maybe be more helpful. Given Black Friday shopping weekend can be hectic for many it doesn't warrant overt rudeness
author: Julian S.

description: There are so many Starbucks in the city but I've been to some in horrible locations with nicer staff. I come here often since I work across the street. I'm writing this review in regards to my service this morning. I got rang up by an Asian male with blonde bleached hair. He threw my change at me on the counter & stood there waiting for me to move as I was trying to pick up the coins. As I started to move he yells "your coffee?! Hello?! Your coffee!!!" I grabbed my coffee & moved to the side to wait for my breakfast sandwich. He comes with it & I have my headphones on so I guess he thought I couldn't hear him but my music was off. He tried to say quietly & sarcastically "thank you, oh your face is so beautiful this morning.." Probably cus I wasn't looking at him since he threw my money at me..?! RUDE.
author: Marie C.

description:
I arranged to meet a friend and his father here to talk over some business ideas. My friend had requested a quiet place near his downtown location and I just spouted out Starbucks as an obvious choice. This particular location was not a good choice. There was nothing wrong with my drink or the people who prepared it for me. The place was clean, but a little on the small side and could've used some better AC on a muggy day like today. The problem was the people here!

With a location so close to Union Square, you're going to have deal with tourists. Now, I love tourists except when they're acting like tourists. At one point, I tried to grab a table and three chairs for my meeting and a surly young girl plopped down and gave me a dirty look while the other two chairs were used for her belongings. She wasn't there first, I was. However, if she'd asked nicely, I would've given her the table as I was standing right next to it waiting. I also got adopted by a family who gathered around me. I finally went outside to wait and a lady stood so close to me that I could count the hairs in her ear even though there was plenty of room outside. Bah. Maybe I just get too freaked out about people sometimes, but mankind can really be a strange species sometimes!

If I'm reviewing the Starbucks (the staff, the premises, the product, etc.), this place gets 4 stars. If I'm reviewing the people frequenting this establishment, they get 1 star. Be warned. The wonderful drinks and service come at a cost!
author: Jason W.

description: This Starbucks is a bit on the smaller side. There isn't really a good area to wait for your drinks.  The baristas here are really quirky though - one started singing a customer's name at some point. My friend really wanted to give him a tip!
author: Danielle C.

description: Great and quick service! Great chai latte! Seriously way better pastries than most Starbuxxx! They are made at La Boulange! The chocolate croissants are to die for! The scones are not that great though. They were playing disco music which made me extra happy since Starbuxxx usually plays rotten jazzy or folksy stuff! Amazingly it was not packed at 8 am when I was here using the free wifi. There aren't enough outlets though. This Starbuxxx is close to Union Square and was convenient for me since I was staying at the very near by Campton Place Hotel. Great place for people watching as you can sit at a long table along one of the windows!
author: Miguel R.

description: The service timing was fine, but the drinks were horrible. The whipped cream on the husbands drink melted before he drank any and the cup was half empty. The barista foamed her milk too long.
author: Annalisa L.

description:
Hot day!
Afternoon!
Need a refreshing drink!
Group of people waiting for their drink!
Fast! 
I didn't have to wait long for my drink!

Why would you order a hot chocolate when it is 80 degrees out????
author: Sarah C.

description: This bucky's is really nice. Their mochas are always good here. Nice and frothy and rich
author: Kevin F.

description: I guess the reviews on here were true. In a rush to have coffee and breakfast and this was across from my hotel. The strawberry creme frap didn't taste like strawberries. My girlfriend has a caramel macchiato latte and it tasted like milk. No taste of caramel or coffee.
author: Joseph R.

description:
How can you not be a fan of Starbucks?  Dont get me wrong Im a Dunkin Donut fan, Im a simple guy who likes flavored coffee, but Starbucks is great.  First off this place is a good size.  It was filled with students, tourists, etc.  They have WIFI, and my girl used the bathroom here and she said it was like a hotel bathroom ;) 

 I personally didnt go in, but I had to buy one of their cookies there since I was waiting for a good 5 minutes.  I also had their white chocolate mochachino?  Venti size.  The place was moving like an assembly line, nice and quick.  People had smiles in their faces, maybe because they just had some coffee.
author: Jeff M.

description: The bathroom smell was terrible. When I say terrible, I mean terrible. The cake pop was also the worst cake pop I've ever had. The drinks were the only thing that was okay
author: Destiny T.

description: When the customers outnumber the employees 25 to 1,something is wrong. You're busy, hire more people!
author: Esti R.

description: PACKED spot for sure. Coffee always worth the wait but wow be warned dont be on the street cars will run you over while your in line
author: Renee G.

description: Service is great. Staffs are friendly. Need to get name so you won't get mix up other people drink.
author: Kailey S.

description: Great job to everyone who hustles and makes this store a quick and friendly stop for the Starbucks enthusiasts!! It's may be packed at times, but even then, the service is quick and friendly. The key here is reciprocal respect ;-)
author: Java F.

description: Usually efficient at getting your order, but no working bathroom is inexcusable.  They also NEVER have any dark roast coffee at any time if day that I come in... even though the menu clearly states blond, medium our dark roast as your options for basic coffee.  I asked today and they said that they stop brewing it at 4pm for some unknown reason.  It's a lot easier to brew a pot of coffee than it is to make those stupid lattes.  Lazy, cheap and they should update their menu.
author: Michael B.

description: After a long day of walking around the city I needed this. For mid afternoon it was fairly busy but everyone working was cheerful.  My iced chai latte was just right- standard starbuck's fair.  There wasn't a lot of seating but this store seemed smaller in general than many others, much more focused on grab and go.
author: Stephanie D.

description: This is by far the slowest Starbucks I've ever been to.  I usually try to stop in for my afternoon coffee before heading back to work from lunch. This is NOT rush hour people. I have left empty handed several times after witnessing only one person behind the counter acknowledging customers while the rest chat about their day. With only three people in line ahead of me, I should be waiting 5 min max to get to the register. Not the case here. Do yourself a favor and go to the one by Sir Francis Drake, much better service.
author: kristi a.

description: Not sure why this place has low ratings- it's a typical starbucks, they all look the same. Everything seems clean, stocked, organized, and the baristas are friendly, polite, and efficient.
author: Kathleen Y.

description:
This Starbucks is in a convenient location in Union Square near the Stockton Tunnel...

Because it is in a good location, it gets very busy...

Because it gets busy, there is often a line and it is often a bit messy/unclean inside... there is also often a bathroom line... And the baristas sometimes seem frazzled... and the drinks sometimes take a while... 

Because of all this, I award just 2 stars... My latte with peppermint syrup yesterday (first time I tried this) yesterday was pretty delicious though!
author: Meghan P.

description: Excellent late night service.  I dropped by for a cup of coffee after a late night dinner and this had to be one of the best coffees I ever had.  Extremely hot and tasty coffee.  Was great !
author: Laszlo M.

description:
The wifi here is always reliable, which is really important to me in cafes. its your pretty standard starbucks with the same menu and so forth. HOWEVER, seating is really limited. 

if you are planning on getting some studying done or meeting up with some partners/groups, think about a different location. this is definitely more of an in-n-out type of place, considering the heavy foot traffic. i have had sooo many times where we met here but had to go somewhere else due to limited seating. dont make my mistake!!
author: Thach N.

description:
Typical Starbucks, nothing too special. What I do like about it is that it was a lot of seating compared to some of the other Starbucks in town, including bar seats along the window, a giant table in the middle, and smaller tables along the side. Great place for late night studying (one of the few places open past 10pm), and a familiar cup of joe. Free wifi, convenient location (near edge of downtown and Chinatown). 

Bathrooms are a nightmare though, so pee BEFORE you get here.
author: Julia H.

description: Note: It's ALWAYS packed. It's a miracle if you come here and there's less than 2 people in line. The great thing about this location though is that they are very well staffed to accommodated the hordes of people. The baristas here are very friendly, which is credit to them considering how much traffic this place gets, especially on a weekday morning.
author: Diana Y.

description: Typical Starbucks conveniently located next to the hotels and parking structure. The only thing that gave them a 3 stars is the slow service. I watched the workers take their time in making drinks and ended up waiting more than 10 minutes for my peach green tea drink.
author: Amanda C.

description: Starbucks on the smaller, slightly more unclean side, is how I would describe this place. Whilst the menu and music is consistent with the Starbucks experience, the seating area isn't crash hot. I wouldn't pick this place to congregate with people. It appears to be a quick stop-off for busy workers and tourists looking for a coffee or bite.
author: Amy M.

description:
I take courses across the street so I stop by often at this location. I'm spoiled with ultra fast Starbucks service since working in the FiDi so slower service often make me grow impatient especially since my break from class is only 8 minutes. 

I noticed it wasn't the employees who were slow, but rather the customers. Many customers who enter this Starbucks are often tourists who take a little longer to order than customers who are regulars. 

This location is also a little darker than the other Starbuck's I've been to. It would be hard for me to read a book or newspaper in here.
author: Vikki K.

description: Another star bucks great location. flavored iced tea is very good. very clean and good service.
author: Figghi I.

description: Ahh, great location -- right in Union Square, plenty of seating.
author: Mel G.

description: Great Starbucks. Ian helped me with my purchase. Very attentive. My Frap was made perfect, and my cookies were heated just right. Tasted like they were just baked.
author: William B.

description: My first time get my latte at this Starbucks. The line was short. I ordered a no foam grande latte. When they call out my order "grande no foam latte" I end up with a latte with 1/2 cup of foam. I ask the barista to remove the foam. She scoop it out and give me back my latte. Therefor I end up with a tall latte in a grande cup. Coffee was super weak.
author: H L.

description: This Starbucks is across the street from Grand Hyatt hotel. A great meet up spot before heading to union square or Chinatown or where ever you plan to visit the city. A plus, this has a bathroom but it's single. So plan on waiting in line.
author: Steve S.

description:
Convenient location. This is my coffee spot at Union Square. Right on the corner, next to the Sutter parking lot. Same coffee, different spot. 

Bathroom needs a password: 1984. Don't let that password fool you though. There is not going to be a boombox and some cardboard laid out on the floor to get your breakdance on.
author: Michael W.

description:
This is my most favorite starbucks ever (and I am a starbucks frequenter.).

This place is my Cheers. Everyone is so friendly, the service is seriously fantastic and they never fuck up my drinks like countless other locations.

Thanks guys!
author: Britney K.

description:
I'm not usually one to review individual franchise locations, but today I thought I'd give it another shot.

I went in because there was no Peet's (proper store) around, the closest one being on 3rd and Mission. Wanting a coffee, but not too strong, I ordered a peppermint mocha, since it is my Starbucks "usual" for a long time now. Aside from the fact that I couldn't taste the peppermint, nor the espresso very much, I had a pleasant experience. The line wasn't too long, the bathrooms were clean, and their exorbitant prices met and far exceeded my expectations. Managed to get a table and sit myself down with my laptop for about 45 minutes. Didn't pay for the WiFi, because it's a crazy thing to do and Starbucks/AT&T charges way too much in the first place (especially when there is free WiFi in Union Square).
author: Andrew L.

description:
Twice now my order for a Clover brewed coffee has been forgotten. This second occasion I timed it. After the order was placed, 5 minutes elapsed before I tried bringing to their attention no one had so much as motioned toward the Clover machine. No one budged. I tried getting someone's attention. To no avail. So I got in line all the whole keeping my eye on the machine. No one so much as looked at it during my entire second trip through the queue. Finally reaching the register, I asked if it was working. He checked. 'Yes. It works. Why?' It was then I explained I had waited for my Clover brewed coffee and it had not been started yet. I had to proceed to explain what bean I wanted. I ordered it the same time, clearly, in English even going so far as to reach over the counter and point and the bloody sign they have printed on the wall behind the barista. He then proceeded to open the wrong bag of beans. So I gave explicit digital instructions as to which one. I damn near walked around to the back behind the counter and brewed it my bloody self.

I cannot express in enough words how troublesome and irritating it is to order a simple cup of coffee at this location. 

Even Yelp! is telling me this post is epic.

My suggestion: take this location's Clover machine away from it and give it to another location. They don't know what the hell the customer is talking about when a Clover coffee is ordered.

This has happened twice now. First time, Starbucks customer service gave me some extra $ on my gift card. Cool. Time wasted. Not cool. Second time, I get a physical free beverage coupon. Second suggestion. I keep coming here to this location for Clover and they should give it to me for free every time now. Because every time I order it, they mess it up.

Either fix the issue or just give me my coffee for free next time. 


Total time waited: 17 minutes.
author: Paul V.

description: Two stars seems harsh, until you realize there are two other Starbucks two blocks away that are serving it up stat. Same coffee, better employees (just better at their jobs).
author: Colleen F.

description:
I have seen a lot of Starbucks including the one in Seattle by the fish market. This place is... well, old schooled. The dark oak finish interior reminds me of a cigar lounge or a coffee shop in Amsterdam. There are plenty of seating and when you first walk in, it takes you back in time a bit. Note: no outdoor seating since it is downtown SF.

The service was excellent and I absolutely love this Starbucks location!
author: Eva Y.

description:
Yesterday afternoon downtown San Francisco was the center of the "hot babe" universe. Standing in front of Nieman Marcus was HOT blonde playing a violin and hawking CD's. I placed a dollar bill into her violin case (I should have written my number on George's face). Then a few minutes later I walk into Banana Republic and standing at the front door I was greeted by a super cute brunette. She unfortunately did not have a violin case available. By the way, I walked out with an arm full of sale items! But why am I talking about that here and not write a separate Banana Republic review? hmmm I dunno.

I was told by a reliable source that this particular Starbucks is the highest revenue producing store in the entire Bay Area. Or maybe she said the entire state? Now I forget. I'll ask her again and update later.

For being such a busy location, the baristas do an excellent job serving up complicated drink orders and smile when handing me over my hot cocoa.
author: V B.

description:
I go here often due to work.
They just remodeled and it looks great.
Prime location.
My latest order was a iced-coffee with milk and a double-splash of vanilla.
author: Derek N.

description: this place is sooo slow at taking an order and filling it. there was no one there and i still had to wait a solid 10 minutes to get a freaking drink. their frappaccinos are all ice, i pretty much wasted $5 on a grande coffee frap, which was like shaved ice with a little flavor on it. only thing i really like about this spot is that they keep the homeless people from coming in and stinking up the tables and eating area.
author: Pamela B.

description: Good solid basic Starbucks. Really hit the spot after all the shopping.
author: Monica H.

description:
I was dragged to this Starbucks Coffee shop to take a break from work and was treated to some bake goods and breakfast and a daily drip coffee.

Coffee - was good, nice and hot but I prefer another coffee chain.

The breakfast - Sausage, Egg & Cheese on English muffin - this was pretty interesting and it was pretty tasty.  They heated up in their oven and the cheese has melted and it was as good as it gets!

Pumpkin Bread - this was really interesting, you can taste the Cinnamon that is in it and the pumpkin flavor was good, not over powerful.  It was really soft and moist and it was really good with the cup of coffee.

Overall another convenient location in downtown, a lot of tourists probably come here to get some warm drinks.  The place is decent size and not much of seating is available.  Sometimes it had a long line depending on the time of the day.

-Parking-
Parking is really not available, street will be difficult, but there is also a parking structure on Stockton Street that's very close.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: I was with my dad getting coffee the other day. My dad ordered a light roast and the cashier who was taking his order made fun of him by repeating his order in an Asian accent. Not happy with this location at all. I'd rather walk a few more blocks down to another one with friendlier service.
author: Silvia Y.

description: Why such bad reviews? This is just a busy Starbucks. But every time I've been, they have always made my drinks correctly. No complaints from me!
author: Natalie S.

description: The closest Starbucks to work. Goof service, great drinks, just no toaster :( (No hot foods, can't toast bagel).
author: Mike Z.

description: This Starbucks at least hasn't gotten my name wrong, yet. I've only been here a couple of time, but service is normal. Nothing special, but nothing bad. Your average Starbucks.
author: Vera W.

description:
This is a busy location and the staff handles it well with consistency. I have been to many Starbucks with no customers and had a terrible drink sloped my way. I would say your safe ordering your extra special nonfat, one shot, extra foamy, halfcaf, one pump drinky here!
Cheers
author: Patricia L.

description:
5 stars for the service.  A Starbucks is basically a Starbucks  . . . no matter where you go in the world.  They are ubiquitous.  This one gets special kudos for extremely pleasant service.

It's got to be tough, in that particular tourist-heavy location, to keep a good attitude.  I was there on a recent afternoon and was impressed enough to make a note of it, and to come home and write this review.

Great job, guys!
author: Erika H.

description:
On a purely intellectual level, I'm not a fan of starbucks. Mass-produced coffee with menu items like the frappuccino, excess packaging, and free trade coffee is not featured. Part of me goes "eff that man! Put your money behind your convictions!" But I need something to get me through the day, and Peet's by Macy's charges premium prices for slow service (hai this is tourist land). Yes, I am sometimes of weak moral constitution.

As a result of this location being a mere 45 seconds from my workplace, I'm here A LOT. Sometimes there is a line and sometimes the bathroom (recently redone) is out of toilet paper but the people that work here try their best to keep things going. They are also cheerful but (usually) not obnoxiously so, and on the rare occasion when they do screw up my order (on my 15 min. break I don't have time to wait for them to make me another drink!) they've always made it up to me.

Maybe I keep coming back here because caffeine is one of the addictions I struggle with daily (another one being shoes), or maybe it's the turkey bacon English muffin sandwiches, or maybe it's that starbucks rewards program that gives me free soy and peppermint in my lattes (I always hate paying more for soy. It's not my fault my body can't digest milk!). It's definitely not the red velvet cupcakes (gross! but the vanilla bean cupcakes are a great treat). I'd like to think it's the good people and the fast drink-making. 

I now judge all other starbucks locations by this one and so far the 24 hour location on California as well as the one in Macy's SF have come up wayyyyy short.

Minus one star because well....it's still not a cappuccino from an Italian bar. Gotta hit north beach for that.
author: Katies F.

description: Got my order wrong, then were extremely rude about it. Then when they do make a mistake, like putting whipped cream on your coffee when asked for no whipped cream, they don't make a new drink, they simply take off the whipped cream with a spoon, then fill the difference with milk. The drink tasted bad & I had a terrible service experience there. Not likely to return.
author: Junel S.

description: Another one of your typical Starbucks, but out of all the ones in the city, probably open the latest. There's always a lot of people inside too, especially since it's so close to Union Square, which is kind of nice for the community atmosphere, but kind of annoying if you actually want a place to sit.
author: Melody L.

description: This place is really busy sometimes because of the proximity to the Powell street cable car.  If it has a line out the door, proceed down Sutter Street to Stockton and there is another one that is usually less filled with tourists.  All of the drinks I had were good but the people were not very friendly which I found surprising.
author: Greg G.

description:
Why the fuck am I reviewing this Starbucks? Customer service.

I'm not here often -- perhaps once or twice a week at most. The SWEETEST Filipina woman works here: she remembers my name, my order, and actually takes the time to ask how I'm doing. It's sad that such gestures of civility color my impressions of a place but WHOOP there it is.

On the other hand, there's a cute muscle-bound guy who works here too, yet he clearly thinks I'm a repugnant piece of shit who looks like the son of The Elephant Man and Madeleine Albright handmaidened by Bruce Vilanch since he always refuses eye contact, any form of address, and practically THREW the lemon scone at me when I was last here. But that's okay since you know I LOVE getting abused by guys who think they're superior to me and/or have a stick up their ass, and after living in SF for a number of years I'm used to the entitled, condescending, fuck off ugly Japo superiority complex of gay turd blossoms as manifested in a fragrant display of behavior both aggressive and passive-aggressive.

WE ARE FA-MI-LY! I GOT ALL MY SISTAS WITH ME!
author: d s.

description:
Boooo!  Here' s why:

Me: "Hi, I'll have a small Depth Charge, please"

Super Cheerful Starbuck "Barista" (SCS"B"): "A what?"

Me: "A Depth Charge...do you know what that is?"

SCS"B": "No, I don't...what is it?"

Me: "It's coffee with a shot of espresso in it." (At least, that's my understanding of what it is, and I've seen it advertised as such in other coffee shops around SF).

Now, most folks would just leave it at that, humor me, and make my depth charge.  But not this one.  Little Miss Sunshine then proceeds to school me on the the correct nomenclature of "coffee with a shot of espresso" AND question my SF native-ness, which is probably one of the worse things you can do to an SF Native (which is something that I happen to be and am proud of, since we seem to be so rare...we're like friggin' unicorns or something).

SCS"B":  "Oh...Well, *here* we call it a "Red Eye" for one shot of espresso in the coffee, a "Black Eye" for two shots of espresso, and a "Black-and-Blue Eye" for three shots of espresso...are you from here?"

Me (handing her my money): "AM I "FROM HERE"?!  YEE-AH I'm "from here"!  Where are YOU from?"

She gives me my "Red Eye" and change (NONE of which went into her scrappy little tip jar!) and turns her plastic smile to the customer behind me, indicating that our time together was over.

I should've known better than to go to Starbuck's.
author: Karen F.

description:
As I have mentioned, I practically make my home at the Hills Plaza Starbucks. My Starb, though responsible for my dwindling bank account, has shown me that this international chain often blamed for the world's problems, is capable of having a neighborhood feel - clean, friendly and superbly run. 

The Stockton/Sutter location, on the other hand, is exactly the kind of place that Howard Schultz and every single Starbucks employee should be ashamed of. 

My most recent visit was to grab a juice for my companion, who happens to be diabetic and was suffering from a very low blood sugar. Because I couldn't afford to wait in line first, I grabbed a juice and made sure he was ok before returning to wait in line. Fifteen minutes later, I was still standing in the line, waiting to pay for the juice. One customer had ordered and paid that entire time, and there were still three people waiting patiently in front of me and several more behind. Behind the counter, there were EIGHT Starbucks employees, six of whom were standing around idly, chatting. I had to ask if it was possible for someone else to open a register before any of the other six employees even made a move. The employee who rang me up (blond bob cut, big earrings, you know who you are) was rude and even made snide remarks to another employee about me while I was standing right there. 

The manager on duty, (thin male, dark hair, glasses, you also know who you are), one of the six employees who was not doing anything to run his business efficiently, was of no help and muttered a faint apology when I let him know of my experience. 

Even if you ignore my unfortunate experience this evening, this Starbucks is regularly the slowest and dirtiest one around. I would highly recommend you try any of the other dozen in the neighborhood - You really can't get much worse than this place.
author: Carolyn C.

description:
I love this Starbucks...not sure what you all have against it.

I've never had a coffee there, but I know for sure if I need to drop a deuce or am in dire need of a cup of ice water, this is the spot!
author: Jason R.

description: Consistently the worst Starbucks I've been to and I have been to many across the entire country.
author: Katharine A.

description:
Skip this review unless you like boobs.

No, really.  This one gets crowded, often a line, not much seating and full of people not feeling the love -- their hotel is no good?

I have a sinking feeling this used to be a really cool local cafe and its ghost is haunting the place.  The windows offer an expansive view of the Grand Hyatt across the street, which explains the pissed off tourists.  You can also see the Stockton Tunnel, the Hannspree shop and the Alessi store :)

The bar counter is pressed up against the window three feet above chest level outside.  Tourist and office girls in high heels wear nice blouses on a warm day and look supper-sweet struggling up the hill in their tight jeans and high heels.  Hey, what else do you want me to look at, the hotel bellmen?  They're gawking too.  With a seat like this who needs pay per view?
author: Gil S.

description:
Although I do hit this Starbucks up, it's mainly for convenience--I park at the Sutter and Stockton garage.  If you're looking for a quick coffee fix, then you should be able to handle this place.  This isn't a Starbucks at which I'd sit and stay.

Some of the downsides to this particular cafe include: usually unclean bathrooms, medium-sized lines, and little seating.  The major downside is that you will almost always find a homeless person outside.  I don't understand it, but they seem to hang out here for some reason.  *shrugs*

*WiFi hotspot (TMobile)
*Oven-warm food
*iTunes WiFi Music Store
author: Brent A.

description:
great.
they have clean bathrooms.
I love it, they have a bunch of single seats looking out towards the busy street. 
go here, study here, live here. 
oh yeah, drinks are a little pricey, it's Starbucks so don't be an idiot expecting a deal.
but, I mean, go here, quick and decent.
author: Dadasd d.

description:
My barista lady was on some serious shit today... She kept staring at the milk containers.. picking them up, putting them down... picking them up, putting them down... 

I was drinking an iced latte... Yet, she wanted to pour hot milk into my cup... 

She put the ice in after wards, (she finally figured out she needed to use cold milk) and filled it up so high, once she put the lid on, it overflowed... She was using her hand and her apron to wipe it off... With her dirty, super shaky hands... 

Worst tasting iced latte ever from starbucks...
author: Jen D.

description: One of my favorite frappuccinos from Starbucks is the Java Chip Frappuccino. The young man at the cashier took my order, and as always, I ordered a Java Chip Frappuccino, and the wait was kind of long...after about 10 minutes, my frappucino was finally ready! I started drinking it, and it tasted alright. Not the best I've ever had though, but it was good! I will come back next time I'm near this Starbucks. :)
author: Cara H.

description:
WATERED DOWN MOCHA... NASTY RESTROOM!!!

I was just there yesterday with my boyfriend and his mom, after shopping we wanted to grab a cup of coffee before heading home.  I wasn't the one that stayed in line to place the order so I didn't have any interesting conversation with the cashier, hehe... lucky me  =)  but it wasn't a pleasant visit for me anyway...

I was sitting down waiting for my boyfriend to come back with my mocha and it took him over 15 minutes so I got impatient and went up to find him.  There he stood so I asked him why so long, and he told me the guy there said 'someone may have taken one of our mocha', and logically you would think they'll make you a replacement right away, hehe... not this place!!!  

So my boyfriend waited, and he saw orders placed after him got fulfilled, so he asked the guy there how much longer for our mocha to be made, and the guy said, 'ah, ok one second'.  Hehe... seriously, that guy had no common sense or what?  It occurred to us that he didn't have much up there.  

If we paid for the mocha and stood there waited, and didn't get it, then they owe us, am I not correct?  'Someone may have taken one of our mocha'?  What does that really mean anyway?  Did he expected us to just say 'ok' and walk away, hehe...  I say the guy there forgot to make my mocha and didn't want to admit to that, maybe? I don't care if someone took my mocha; I want my mocha, hehe... that's all  =)

Anyways, after we got the mocha, I needed to use their restroom before the long drive.  The line was not too long, with 3 people ahead of me, so I waited.  OMG, their restroom was sooooo nasty.  The door you have to pull really hard to shut (someone could have fixed the door, ya know, considering so many customers each day).  The garbage can was full and toilet papers were all over the floor.  It was not a place I wanted to be in.  Contract those muscles if you have to  =)  Oh, and the mocha, tasted like crap.  I tossed mine before I got into the car in the parking structure cross the street  =(
author: Adrienne K.

description:
I used to work up the street from here and I would come here for a lunchtime Frapuccino during the hot days and my complaints are:

1. Cashiers are too slow
2. They always forget to make my drink until they have served EVERYONE else
3. There are always bugs/flies in the pastry thingy

I do come here when it is late and no one is in here. That results in my 1 star rating.
author: Christina B.

description: I came here to grab a quick cup of coffee. The service was pretty good that day and we got our coffee in good shape.
author: Anthony L.

description:
I've never been to such a poorly maintained Starbucks. What happened to this one?!

Before I walk in, I step in a fatty puddle of a Matcha Green Tea drink that's right at the entrance to their doors. Awesome. I go in and let the barista know and he blatantly ignores me. I tell him AGAIN, this time a little louder to make sure he can hear me and all he does is say "I know.", makes zero eye contact, and continues to go about his business. 

Then, it gets worse.

I use their bathroom and it smells as though somebody has peed all over the walls. Gross. There are zero toilet seat covers and no toilet paper to be found. All that's out is a small pile of Starbucks napkins.

When I make my exit, I see about 3 or 4 employees behind the counter- 1 staring into space, and the Green Tea puddle still looming outside the doors.

I feel like I got dirtier just going to this Starbucks.

Management needs to step it up and clean up their employees' attitudes and establishment.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I usually come to this Starbux when meeting up with friends because it's one of the larger Sbux & one of few locations that stays open past 7pm.  I like the staff here. Some baristas are from overseas, so adds an "Int'l" element. Fitting for touristy downtown. FYI: Can get kinda busy since it's located right across from Grand Hyatt SF, but always less of a wait than @ the fancier one on Powell, next to St. Francis Drake.
author: Rebecca S.

description: I go here pretty much every single day and am greeted with such an air of energy and cheer - I love it. It's the perfect start to my morning! I prefer going to this one than the one on Powell and Sutter because the staff is friendlier and give me fantastic service every time. I'm one of those people with paragraph orders with amendments and additions to my drink - and I have never gotten a huff (like I often notice in other locations). I've even gotten suggestions on how to maximize the flavor on my order! Today I ordered a caramel frappuccino with extra caramel and I wanted a shot blended in, dude who rang me up told me to try it floated and I went along with it. I ended up with the best thing to start my morning. Compliments to everyone there!
author: Aeone S.

description: Fast and delicious. A bit too full between 8 and 10 AM but for the rest of the time a lot of space and great atmosphere.
author: Philipp W.

description: beware long assssss lines.  Theyve must upa couple times but then again what coffeee place doesnt from time to time
author: Randy C.

description: The staff has changed a lot. Great customer service is the same. If I was out with someone and they said "lets get some coffee" I would try my best to get to THIS Starbucks.
author: J. B.

description:
(before reviewing, let me just say that karen f's review is hysterically funny to me because the *exact same thing* has happened to me and i thought it was so ridiculous it couldn't have possibly ever happened to anyone else... apparently this particular starbucks trains their employees to be cheeky and unpleasant.)

i hate this starbucks. i don't usually use the word hate, but i've actually been scolded (yes, scolded), corrected, and outright lectured by baristas on multiple occasions and once by a store manager about the "incorrectness of my order"...

... i always order an expresso macchiato with extra foam. i order this (emxf) at every starbucks, all the time. occasionally someone wants to charge me for the extra foam (whatever), but the employees at this starbucks go out of their way to lecture/scold (and thus embarrass) me in public by informing me that they won't make my emxf, despite that i've already paid for it, because it's really a dry cappuccino.  

if that weren't bad enough, they then launch into a full-on lecture of how incorrect i am by ordering my emxf and then when i tell them that no other starbucks has problems making my drink, they tell me i'm lying.  (now i'm not crazy, if no other starbucks would make my emxf without charging me for a dry cappuccino, then i'd start ordering dry cappuccinos)

that's fine if you wanna call my drink something else, but just make it for me since i've already paid. no lecture needed.
author: lisa w.

description: Why can"t they be friendly and more importantly be helpful to their customers than their co-workers. Seems they are busy catching up with each other behind the counter, almost every time I go there. I go there because it is the nearest coffee shop from my work. If not, I wouldn't even try , getting ignored or unhelped so often.
author: Ketina T.

description: The coffee here is not all that great .. it's not really that strong . I personally prefer Peet's or Tully's but I would come to this Starbucks when I'm too lazy to walk to another coffeehouse . Their cookies taste weird but their rice krispies with marshmallows and M&Ms are really good !! *DROOLS* haha . I like how this Starbucks isn't super crowded like the other ones in downtown .
author: Eileen L.

description: Souless, terrible tea, and I refuse to go somewhere that serves "Large", "Grande", and "Vente" instead of "Small", "Medium" and "Large" sized drinks.  For Gods' sake, what kind a pig-ignorant consumers do they think we are?
author: Alan B.

description: What part of Tall Sweetened Iced Coffee do the baristas not understand at this Starbucks? I sympathize that it can get busy  and a lot of them are rude tourists (I work in the area), but I'm not one of them and I never EVER am rude to people who prepare my food for karmic reasons. However at this particular Starbucks, no matter your demeanor the end result is the same: f*cked up drinks. I admit there are a few diamonds in the rough at this Starbucks- but they're drowned out by the rest of the douche bags (and that includes the girls that work there).
author: Manny V.
